title: Celtics bench shines in bounce-back win over Magic: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Celtics secured a 111-107 win over the Magic, splitting their two-game series in Orlando.
Luka Garza contributed significantly with 16 points and 8 rebounds, including key plays in the fourth quarter.
Anfernee Simons scored 25 points in the first half, sparking a key second-quarter run for Boston.

title: Jason Varitek is happy to be back with Red Sox on a new deal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jason Varitek signed a new contract to remain with the Boston Red Sox for the 2026 season.
Varitek has been a coach on Alex Cora’s staff, contributing to game-planning and run prevention.
Carlos Narvaez, Red Sox catcher, is noted for his strong 2025 performance and potential for growth.

title: Patriots’ explosive rookie class breaks through at perfect time in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rookies Kyle Williams and TreVeyon Henderson scored three touchdowns in the Patriots' 28-23 victory over the Buccaneers.
Williams' 71-yard touchdown and Henderson's two long scoring runs propelled the Patriots to a seventh consecutive win.
Rookie offensive line play helped limit Drake Maye to one sack, while defensive rookies contributed key stops against Tampa.

title: Oddsmakers have Drake Maye as NFL MVP favorite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye leads as NFL MVP favorite on FanDuel following Patriots' 28-23 victory over the Buccaneers.
Maye has thrown 19 touchdowns, passed for 2,555 yards, and rushed for 283 yards this season.
Patriots' seven-game winning streak enhances Maye's MVP odds over quarterbacks Josh Allen and Patrick Mahomes.

title: Rob Gronkowski announces that he will ‘retire as a Patriot’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rob Gronkowski will sign a one-day contract with the New England Patriots to retire with the team.
Gronkowski, who spent nine seasons with the Patriots, has not played since the 2022 NFL playoffs.
Gronkowski is a three-time Super Bowl winner with the Patriots and holds their record for career receiving touchdowns.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Buccaneers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams significantly contributed to a 28-23 victory over Tampa Bay.
Drake Maye threw 16-for-31 with critical deep connections, maintaining New England's winning streak despite a low completion rate.
Patriots' tight ends and Christian Barmore had limited impact, with minimal contributions and a struggle in run defense.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ impressive road win over Buccaneers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams combined for three touchdowns in a 28-23 win over the Buccaneers.
Quarterback Drake Maye threw for 270 yards, two touchdowns, and one interception, continuing to impress despite some turnovers.
Patriots' defense initially struggled but tightened up, ultimately aiding a seventh consecutive victory for the team.

title: MBTA Transit Police officer facing drunk driving charge after allegedly crashing into pole
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA Transit Police officer Jonathan Daveiga arrested Oct. 19 for alleged drunk driving after crashing into a pole.
Daveiga, charged with operating under the influence, pleaded not guilty and was released on personal recognizance.
Daveiga placed on 'modified duty' pending court process; next court date scheduled for Dec. 19.

title: Allston Car Wash employees still in federal custody after ICE raid
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nine Allston Car Wash employees with work permits were detained by ICE agents on November 4, 2025.
Attorney Todd Pomerleau reports difficulty in obtaining information from ICE about the employees' custody status.
Allegations of mistreatment include reports of detainees at ICE's Boston office being denied food and showers.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Nikki Glaser hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Comedian Nikki Glaser hosted 'SNL' on November 8, 2025, with Sombr as the musical guest.
Glaser's popularity surged in 2024 after standout performances at the Tom Brady roast and hosting the Golden Globes.
Highlights of the episode included Glaser's monologue, Sombr's music, and Pete Davidson's return to 'Weekend Update.'
